alert.note: Alert for Northumberland; Richmond (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 9:07PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN NORTHUMBERLAND AND EAST CENTRAL RICHMOND COUNTIES THROUGH 1000 PM EDT... At 907 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Heathsville, or near Callao, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Heathsville around 915 PM EDT. Lewisetta around 920 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Lara, Edwardsville, Howland, Lottsburg, Middletons Corner, Avalon, Moon Corner, Dodlyt, Mulch, and Hull Neck. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
